page.title: 06The School Curriculum
page.content: For the Infants at Stibbard Annexe most work is aimed at enabling them to read, write, and begin to use and understand numbers. Afternoons are often given over to free play with constructional toys, jigsaw puzzles,or the "home corner" in which a small group plays at being a family, in a space filled with small chairs, a table, cooking utensils, and other household effects. The Junior timetable at Ryburgh is more formal and includes English (Reading, Writing, Drama, and Language Construction), Mathematics, Science, Religion,Art & Craft(Painting,Drawing, Modelling etc). History and Geography are usually treated as overlapping 'topics' of which "The Sea" or "Castles" are two examples. Physical Education includes gymnastics, football, hockey and netball.
